DOC.brief_summary: This pilot research trial study long term effect tyrosine kinase inhibitor therapy ovarian reserve fertility patient chronic myeloid leukemia gastrointestinal stromal tumor . Studying ovary imaging , ovarian reserve marker , hormone level patient receive tyrosine kinase inhibitor therapy may help doctor learn effect tyrosine kinase inhibitor therapy ovarian function fertility .
DOC.brief_title: Long Term Effects Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitor Therapy Ovarian Reserve Fertility Patients With Chronic Myeloid Leukemia Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumor
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To collect preliminary information help design study look longitudinal change marker ovarian reserve menstruation premenopausal woman undergo tyrosine kinase inhibitor ( TKI ) therapy . SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . Evaluate ovarian response control ovarian hyperstimulation patient elect undergo vitro fertilization ( IVF ) fertility preservation . OUTLINE : Patients undergo transvaginal ultrasound antral follicle analysis collection serum ovarian reserve marker hormonal analysis TKI therapy 12 , 24 , 48 week .
DOC.criteria: Diagnosed chronic myeloid leukemia ( CML ) , gastrointestinal stromal tumor ( GIST ) , non metastatic cancer TKI first line agent Premenopausal ( menses time precede 12 consecutive month ) Has undergone hysterectomy bilateral oophorectomy Willing use nonhormonal ( ie : barrier method abstinence ) form contraception one year study Patients chemotherapy radiotherapy past Patients may receive investigational agent Patients must pregnant nursing Other medical condition treatment affect hormonal level ( potentially confound interpretation result ) Patients ongoing hormonal contraception unwilling unable discontinue eligible
